1.text: If you then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sits on the right hand of God.

2.text: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

3.text: For you are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

4.text: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall you also appear with him in glory.

5.text: Mortify therefore your members which are on the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

6.text: For which thingsâ€™ sake the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience:

7.text: In the which you also walked some time, when you lived in them.

8.text: But now you also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.

9.text: Lie not one to another, seeing that you have put off the old man with his deeds;

10.text: And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:

11.text: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free: but Christ is all, and in all.

12.text: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, long-suffering;

13.text: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do you.

14.text: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfection.

15.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also you are called in one body; and be you thankful.

16.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

17.text: And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

18.text: Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

19.text: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

20.text: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing to the Lord.

21.text: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.

22.text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh; not with eye-service, as men pleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God;

23.text: And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not to men;

24.text: Knowing that of the Lord you shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for you serve the Lord Christ.

25.text: But he that does wrong shall receive for the wrong which he has done: and there is no respect of persons.
